Case Study

ABM

Template Systems

Team

  • Agency
  • Blue Bird Strategies
  • Visual Designer
  • Jake Wakefield
  • Account Managers
  • Anita Williams
  • Dan Supinski
  • User Experience
  • Trever Santora
  • Project Manager
  • Anna Supinski
  • Development
  • John Zupin

Business Challenge

ABM wasn’t using their automation platform, Marketo, to produce marketing material.

Process

To assist the marketing team at ABM we knew we would need to gather a lot of information about their vertical and internal goals from stakeholders in charge of the division.

We conducted interviews with key senior members and sent follow-up surveys to their staff.

From the initial findings we produced a summation of what we learned along with recommendations and scope.

In order to produce a successful content marketing strategy inside of their platform they would need to amass a trove of interchangeable email, landing page and form templates.

The templates would coincide with a design pattern library which could be culled by users from Marketo’s internal wysiwyg.

Hiccups

We went with lo-fi wireframes and a pattern library to avoid building 18 hi-fidelity comps. It turns out our plan didn’t go quite as smoothly as imagined. Stakeholders expressed confusion over the presentation of our first draft. They had a hard time “grasping the [overall] vision,” in the context of a cohesive content strategy.

We were able to clear up the confusion by producing a final document which explained in depth the how each template and its respective sections address different user or business needs.

Results

The final wireframes and pattern library was received with open arms from the marketing team. After the UX artifacts were delivered we worked with the development team closely monitoring the outcome of the final coded templates.

Almost two years later and the templates are still in heavy rotation. The internal team at ABM reported a significant increase in productivity, upwards of 50%. Overall campaign success is up 30% since the first three quarters from launch.

Continual Improvement

We developed a series of training materials in the form of screencasts for the marketing team. We also provided A/B test options for alternate call-to-action text, color choices and headline copy.
